intro: Hieracium ustedalicum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium ustedalicum is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
